text.34_Daf, 43_Line: [Adam was] behind [last] in the work of the creation and before [the others] for retribution. ...
text.34_Daf, 62_Line: The text refers only to the place of the cut. ...
text.34_Daf, 21_Line: whereas here it was stated [that such strips may be set up] for WELLS, implying that there is no difference whether they were public or private? —
text.34_Daf, 49_Line: And He formed [wa-yizer] was written in Scripture ...with two yods;
text.34_Daf, 46_Line: But [it refers] to the flood; for it is written in Scripture: ...
text.34_Daf, 38_Line: A full face and the other explains: ...
text.34_Daf, 50_Line: according to him, however, who explained: ‘A tail’ what [could be the significance of] ‘And he formed’? —
text.34_Daf, 59_Line: ‘And closed up the place with flesh instead thereof’, is quite intelligible; ...
text.34_Daf, 52_Line: ‘Woe to me on account of my evil inclination; woe to me on account of my creator’,
text.34_Daf, 27_Line: We learned elsewhere: R. Judah ruled: ...
text.34_Daf, 61_Line: R. Zebid (or as some say: R. Nahman b. Isaac) replied: ...
text.34_Daf, 42_Line: As R. Ammi explained, for R. Ammi said: ...
text.34_Daf, 36_Line: And the Lord God builded the side etc. Rab and Samuel [differ on the meaning of ‘side’]. ...
text.34_Daf, 57_Line: In the image of God created He him; [and he explained:] At first it was the intention that two should be created but ultimately only one was created.
text.34_Daf, 68_Line: ‘And the Lord God builded’:  R. Hisda stated [or, as others say, it was taught in a Baraitha]:
text.34_Daf, 33_Line: The first man  had two full faces, for it is said in Scripture: ...
text.34_Daf, 53_Line: According to him who explained: ‘A full face’ it was quite correct for Scripture to write:
text.34_Daf, 44_Line: One may well concede that he was ‘behind in the work of the creation’, since he was not created before the Sabbath eve; what means, however, ‘Before [the others] for retribution’?
text.34_Daf, 63_Line: According to him who explained: ‘A tail’ it was quite proper for Scripture to write: ...
text.34_Daf, 64_Line: And He builded, but according to him who explained: ‘A full face’, what [could be the significance of] ‘And He builded’? —
text.34_Daf, 10_Line: It may be said [to agree] even [with the ruling of] Hanania for a cistern and a well belong to two different categories.
text.34_Daf, 40_Line: According to him who explained: ‘a full face’, it was quite proper for Scripture to state: ...
text.34_Daf, 23_Line: What is the meaning of deyomadin?
text.34_Daf, 60_Line: but according to him who explained: ‘A tail’, what [could be the meaning of] ‘And closed up the place with flesh instead thereof’? —
text.34_Daf, 66_Line: For R. Simeon b. Menassia made the following exposition: ‘And the Lord God builded the side’  teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, plaited Eve's hair and then brought her to Adam, for in the sea-towns a plait is called ‘building’.
text.34_Daf, 54_Line: Male and female created He them; but according to him who explained: ‘A tail’, what [could be the interpretation of] ‘Male and female created He them’?-
text.34_Daf, 47_Line: And He blotted out every living substance which was upon the face of the ground, both man and cattle etc. ...
text.34_Daf, 14_Line: It may be said [to agree] even [with the ruling of] Hanania, for he only replied to that of which the first Tanna had spoken.
text.34_Daf, 20_Line: Strips of wood may be set up round a public well only’,
text.34_Daf, 16_Line: ‘Strips of wood may be provided for a public well, a public cistern as well as for a private well, but for a private cistern a screen ten handbreadths high must be provided; so R. Akiba’,
text.34_Daf, 58_Line: According to him who explained: ‘A full face’, the expression of ...
text.34_Daf, 28_Line: All wild figs are exempt [from the restrictions of demai] excepting those of deyufra.
text.34_Daf, 31_Line: A tree that bears fruit twice a year.
text.34_Daf, 56_Line: Male and female created He them.  Previously it is written:
text.34_Daf, 41_Line: Thou hast shaped me behind and before; but according to him who explained: ‘A tail’, what [could be the meaning of] Thou hast shaped me behind and before? — ...
text.34_Daf, 51_Line: [It may be explained] in agreement with R. Simeon b. Pazzi, for R. Simeon b. Pazzi said,
text.34_Daf, 13_Line: must one then assume that our Mishnah is not in agreement [with the ruling of] Hanania? —
text.34_Daf, 55_Line: [The text was required] for [an explanation] like that of R. Abbahu. For R. Abbahu pointed out an incongruity: It is written in Scripture:
text.34_Daf, 9_Line: Ropes [may be put up] round a cistern but not strips of wood? —
text.34_Daf, 7_Line: Strips of wood may be put up round a cistern and ropes around a caravan,
text.34_Daf, 18_Line: [Does it not then follow:] only for WELLS but not for cisterns? — It may be said [to be in agreement] even with R. Akiba, for it only taught of a well of living water because [the law in its case is] definite, there being no difference whether it was public or private, but it did not teach concerning a cistern containing collected [water] since [the law in its case] is not definite.
text.34_Daf, 12_Line: Since it was not stated Hanania ruled: ‘Ropes must be put up round a cistern and strips of board [may be put up] round a well’, it may be inferred that [according] to the view] of Hanania both in the case of a cistern and in that of a well, only ropes are permitted but not strips of wood;
text.34_Daf, 69_Line: This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, built Eve in the shape  ...
text.34_Daf, 15_Line: Must it be assumed that our Mishnah is at variance with [a ruling of] R. Akiba; for we learned:
text.34_Daf, 65_Line: In agreement with that which has been stated by R. Simeon b. Menassia.
text.34_Daf, 22_Line: It may be said to agree even with R. Judah b. Baba, for by WELLS were meant [public] wells in general.
text.34_Daf, 6_Line: Must one assume that our Mishnah is not in agreement [with a ruling of] Hanania; for it was taught:
text.34_Daf, 17_Line: whereas here it was stated [that such strips of wood may be provided] for WELLS.
text.34_Daf, 34_Line: Thou hast shaped me behind and before. ...
text.34_Daf, 26_Line: Mnemonic: Two, under a ban, praise, dove, house, two, was cursed, by a relationship three.
text.34_Daf, 45_Line: Shall I say [it refers] to the curse, surely, [it could be objected] was not the serpent cursed first, Eve afterwards and Adam last? — ...
text.34_Daf, 48_Line: According to him who explained: ‘a full face’ it is easy to see why
text.34_Daf, 19_Line: Need it be suggested that our Mishnah is at variance with a ruling of R. Judah b. Baba; for we learned, ‘R. Judah b. Baba ruled:
